content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												Cave Story is lauded by many players and reviewers as a grand masterpiece of an indie game. I disagree, I think it's popularity as a novel, well constructed freeware experience inflated the reputation of this little game to the point that years later it simply doesn't hold up to the hype.Before diving in, I'll make the simple statement that $15 is severly overpriced for 3-4 hours of a sub-par experience.The story was perhaps what dissapointed me most. The story for this game is said by some (including its own store page) to be rich and original. Unfortunately, this just isn't the case. The story is an extremely straight forward "mad scientist trying to take over the world" narrative, with the miguided (if persistent) drive to constantly be extremely cute that a lot of Japanese media today shares. Some of the characters seem interesting, but an overall lack of meaningful characterisation makes them more like simple cartoon characters the player can immediately understand rather than authenitc people and animals. The closest game narrative to Cave Story's that I can think of is Sonic the Hedgehog 2, and that's a pretty low bar.While maybe I can excuse what I view to be an extremely typical, lackluster story, I can't forgive the dissapointing gameplay. Any allusions to the Metriodvania genre when reffering to Cave Story are misleading at best. The game does not permit, require, or encourage exploration or mystery in a major way, let alone use it as a core engagment. The fairly fast paced action-platforming does provide some challenge, but it doesn't hold up over time.The jumping and shooting simply doesn't create a large number of interesting challenges or situations during the game. After the first hour the mechanics of the game have basically played themselves out, and nothing experientially different really comes out of the gameplay, largely due to the repetitive design of enemy encounters. The weapon leveling system is novel and seems like a good idea; for the first hour or so I played very deliberately so I could get my weapons to maximum power and keep them there. However, this quickly becomes old hat and the interesting idea of this system just becomes tedious when the game gets tougher, and taking a single hit can force you to switch from attacking to recovering lost power ups over and over again.I was dissapointed by Cave Story, but I would still recommend people to try it out. The original version is available for download on the internet for free, and at that price it's worth it to play through and form your own opinions. If nothing else, the free version of Cave Story is worth playing in order to see a piece of foundational indie-gaming history.TL,DR: Doesn't live up to the hype, uninspired story and unengaging gameplay. Not worth $15 but the free version is online so I recommend trying it for yourself.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
TL;DR: For a first-time player Cave Story is a solid title that has some nice surprises and that I would highly recommend, but as someone that played the original I'm extremely disappointed with this port not improving the flow of the game after all these years.I played the freeware version awhile back and this one is slightly more polished, and with a few things added in. When I played Cave Story the first time it was a cool little free indie title, so it's amount of depth and ideas surprised me and I was pretty forgiving with it. That being said, the issues I had with it seem to remain unchanged. The game has 3 different endings and even some secrets. Solid replayability, right? It would be, if the pacing was better.- Fetch quests...Every time, without fail, the fetch quests discourage me from wanting to play through Cave Story again. Even the first time I played, they seemed overly-convoluted just for the sake of artifically lengethening the game. The rocket portion isn't nearly as offensive as the bomb and dog-catching parts, but still annoying.- Unskippable dialogue. This is unexcusable for a re-release. At least allow me to hold down a button to speed through text. Technically you can, but you have to press a button at the end of every single chunk of text, so it really defeats the point. What's worse, there's tons of dialogue in the beginning portions of the game, so it further hinders the desire to replay Cave Story.- In typical RPG fashion, you have to interact with specific NPCs or items in a specific order to progress through the story. It feels very unintuitive and could have been handled better. Particularly with the bomb part, combined with unskippable dialogue, it really kills the pacing.- The things you have to do to get to the real final level. The amount of unintuitive BS you have to do to access the true final area is dumb. Just the whole situation with Dr. Booster falling is infuriating. Your natural instinct is to go down and save him. Ok so he dies and gives you the booster, alright. But wait how do you actually save him? By not trying to save him....no explanation given. Even worse, it's VERY difficult to not fall down, and once you do fall down, you cannot get back up without the booster, so you'd better hope you saved just beforehand or you're screwed. Nevermind all the very specfic steps involved with saving Curly Brace...- 1-hit KO spikes. I get it, it's a 2D game and they need ways to up the challenge, but this has always felt like lazy game design to me. Particularly here where I'm a robot designed for battle and yet somehow the slighest touch of a spike kills me evem after having all upgrades.- Not being able to customize the weapon quick-swap rotary is extremely inconvenient. In the middle of battle I want to change my weapon without cycling through the weapons I hardly use. If I ever want to use them again, then let me just equip them.Cave Story has a lot of cool things about it, but this mostly feels like a paid Steam port (of a free game) with slightly nicer graphics and sound, that did nothing to address some of its issues.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												A fun little indie game. Does it "invoke classic Metroid"? No. Is it as good as Metroid? No. The only thing it has in common with Metroid is the sound when you grab a health powerup. But for what it is, it is done very well. Indeed the NES could have used more games like this rather than having roughly 90% of its games be complete garbage that I found out through many wasted weekends renting ♥♥♥♥ing trash games when I was younger. This game has great retro graphics and good sound and music, good weapons and enemies, and solid level design. Retro platformers should always be welcome to any gamer with a brain.The only thing that killed this game dead in the water for me was the last battle. You have to fight 4 bosses with 1 life bar and a life full up jar, and it's not that it is hard that gets me, just pure frustration at it's worst. Trust me, beat the first 3 bosses with 1 life bar then use the jar for the final battle. That is your only hope. If you die, you have to do it all over again and go through all the dialogue. It will test even the most dedicated persons patience. There are no words to describe the frustration it causes. Don't get me wrong, I beat it after many tries, but the infinite frustration level still remained. Besides the last battles completely ruining it for me, I liked it.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2014
												EDIT/UPDATE: It has very recently come to my attention that Nicalis has decided to raise the price of the game from $9.99 to $14.99. In addition to this, it seems that Nicalis has also decided to not put the game on anymore sales, and from what I have heard, there hasn't been anything done to the game content-wise that could justify this. In other words, Nicalis has decided to raise the price just to gain more money. I can no longer see any reason to purchase this version of Cave Story, as I mentioned in my original review (which will still be posted below this paragraph) that there isn't enough content to justify a full price purchase of this particular version. Instead of purchasing this version of the game, I advise that you just go and download the freeware version of the game, as you will be saving a whole lot of money just downloading the freeware version than by buying an overpriced version of a game that, while good, isn't worth $14.00. $9.99 was already steep, but increasing the price without even adding any content to justify it is pathetic. Don't give Nicalis your money.  ORIGINAL POST: Despite starting one of the worst trends in gaming (indie gaming, to be more exact), Cave Story is actually a pretty damn good game made by just a single person. Of course, with that being said, I suggest that you play the original freeware version of the game first before using your money to buy Cave Story +, as this particular version of the game isn't much different from the original freeware game, save for some bonus content and some minor improvements. If you do decide that you want to purchase this version of the game, do wait a little to see if it goes on sale, as I don't think that there is enough content to justify a full-price purchase of this version of the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is hugely popular, but I was disappointed. Maybe you'll like it, though, and I hope my review can help you decide.My biggest issue was that it's often called a Metroidvania, but the first 80% of the game was missing any exploration: the gameplay is very linear, even if you're doing some backtracking. The bosses and minibosses are a bit repetitive. There's very little in the way of puzzle bosses or even puzzles in general, unless you count talking to everyone until you find the right dialogue trigger.Thematically it's a bit of a mess: a hodgepodge of sci-fi and fantasy. (These two genres certainly can be combined well, but it needs to be done coherently.) The story is not that epic or original, and the dialogue could use some serious editing. The description calls the game "massive", and that's a definite exaggeration.The action gameplay itself is pretty good. The controls felt a bit floaty to begin with, but this gets much better when you gain the ability to hover. The leveling system for weapons is a nice touch. There's a good variety of weapons, but 95% of the time I just went with the machine gun.So if you want an action platforming game with charming retro graphics, cute soundtrack, and straightforward gameplay that you can finish in a few hours, this could easily be the game for you. If you've heard it's a massive Metroidvania or that the story is amazing, I would temper my expectations.

number of helpful: 11 of 26 people (42%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												When I say I don't recommend Cave Story+, what I really mean is, I recommend the original (and free) Cave Story instead.It's not that Cave Story+ is bad, really. There's some interesting extra stuff to try out. It's just really not worth paying for it. Updated graphics and music is nice, but the originals were fine and undeniably had a certain charm to them. The new English translation, while in some regards technically better, lacks many of the quirks that Aeon Genesis' original translation made beloved by English-speaking fans ("huzzah!"). And things like difficulty modes are essentially redundant, since there already exist established challenges that simulate harder difficulties.What would really have made for a nice Cave Story+ would be the inclusion of more flexible tools, like a level editor. That, I think, would've been well worth the money.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2012
												55/10One of the best Indie games. If not THE best.It's a great mix of Metroid, Castlevania and (a little bit of) Zelda.The story, the characters, the combat system, the music, everything is just awesome.And to top it all, certain decisions grant other items or lead to different endings which provides a high replay value.Warning: Extremely addictive. I've finished it 6 times and it still isn't boring.Great extra: You can choose if you want to play the game in the original art style (as Pixel, the creator of the original game, made it) or in an enhanced style with smoother, hand-drawn-like graphics.The same goes for the soundtrack (original chiptune-like, remastered and new).

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												I heard great things about this game so, I went in with high expectations. My first mistake was using the keyboard to play, don't do that, use a ♥♥♥♥ing controller. I didn't get very far in this and unfortunately I don't ever want to.Cavestory poorly starts players off in a setting where they dont know what they are doing. Now i'm ok with being thrown into the action but, cavestory did it in a way without any guidence what so ever.This goes for controls (partly my bad), the level design and the plot. You can't attack right off when you have enemies in front of you implying that ther'es some way to defeat them and there was no clue, no hint that I had to dodge these ♥♥♥♥ers for 5 good minutes until I found my gun.It left me feeling like I was doing something wrong and that's not a good feeling for the player to have at the start of game.The music is well done and has many variations (original, remastered and new) but, i felt it was a little generic if not cookie cut, same goes for the graphics. Maybe that's the point but, meh.Controls for the game I felt were akward and clunky, the keys were not even rebindable. Again my bad for not using a controller but, hey, you released it for pc, do your ♥♥♥♥ing job. Even with a  controller i'm like 90% sure the clunkiness wouldn't have improved.The story (as little as I got in the first...village?) thus far was uninvolving as if the character didn't have any connection to anything around him at all. (Is that the point? If so...why?)The difficulty isn't what makes you die in this game, it's the fact that you have to die, memorize certain traps or suprise enemy locations and redo it, very frustrating. The enemy designs just seemed so half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥I never want this to be the kind of standard for any indie developer, ever, sorry.3 out of 10 peashooters

number of helpful: 7 of 26 people (27%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												This is not a good PC port...of a free game that's already on PC. The original game, a grand freeware game by Pixel, was light, functional and compatible. This, one of many ports responsible mainly by Nicalis, is none of those.Faulty gamepad support, crash prone, lack of resolution options (including any widescreen support, which the Wii version was able to [poorly] do), tacked on extra modes (the difficulty modes are self-imposable), and the, "so-bland-it's-meh," soundtracks and script of the oher rehash ports. On the plus side, this is Cave Story: a wonderful action platformer. On the case for this specific version, at least the graphics are decent and it does include a cut area, but, ultimately, it's not worth spending money over.This all happened in a manner of minutes. A terrible job on behalf of Nicalis.Stick with the original version (it's FREE, nothing to lose), or, if you really wanted to buy Cave Story, the 3DS version would be the only one I'd reccomend purchasing (all features from CS+, portability, optional 3D, supports proper 16:9, stable, $10). If you want to support Pixel (you should), go buy 10 copies of Azarashi instead.

number of helpful: 8 of 29 people (28%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Everything that made the freeware publish of this game what it was is not improved or expaned upon in this Steam port. You can argue and debate about how you can toggle off the extra things like the (awful) remixed music but that's avoiding the point. The point is that the very worthwhile experience of this game is available for free and this port does nothing to expand upon the (rather high) benchmark that it's predecessor set.A quick google search will show you how you can install the freeware publish of this game and a english patch (if needed). I would strongly recommend doing that, it is a very well-made gem of a game.

												listen, before you let your fanboyism lash out at me, just listen.this game is a love letter to difficult games yes, but objectively it clings to video game tropes that really need to die. I really don't mind difficulty in a game, if you even briefly browse my profile you can see that, however there is a major difference between fun difficulty and frustrating difficulty. let me explain in detail...i really don't appreciate seperate endings that depend on arbatrary actions, IE having to make a jump that most would deem impossible with permenant reprocautions.i really don't appreciate being given choices that downgrade my character for 40% of the game with absolutely no idea before-hand IE being given the choice of choosing a different gun with no option of going back.I really don't appreciate having to replay huge sections of the game, because the creator refuses to put an extra checkpoint in because he insists on clinging to archaic game design. ghosts and goblins may be your childhood, but let's face the facts, that game would not have suffered, nor your experience, if it had the option to save.but lastly, i really don't appreciate jumping through many arbitrary loops, so that i can get a non-♥♥♥♥♥♥ ending, only to come to a nigh-impossible set of obstacles and 4 bosses. listen, i know you think you feel much more satisfied knowing you beat hell, and 4 bosses, but I challenge you to think about something... would your experience REALLY have suffered if there was a checkpoint after hell? or after the first boss? or the second? or the third? would you really have thrown down the controller and been "AHH ♥♥♥♥! AND I WAS HAVING SO MUCH FUN BEING CHALLENGED"i really doubt it. but for those of us who memorized patterns for hell, and for the three of the four bosses, and still die, it's frustrating, its assinine and it. is. not. fun.i would love to reccomend this game for the first half, which is fun and challenging and almost worth the price of admission, but once you hit the wall of rediculous challenge, only to be let down by a sub-par ending, and then finding out that a much shinier ending lies behind 7 impregnable doors... i just can't ask anyone else to go through it.this game is not horrible, but it is not the glorified masterpiece that everyone insists it is. do yourself a favor and stick to super meat boy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Cave Story is a 2D platformer/shooter that's sort of like Mega Man or Metroid at a glance, but feels very different. This is one of my favorite games, and the Steam version is the best version I know of. It has a lot of different options, including which graphics style it uses and which version of the sound track (both of which are great, by the way).     This is a simple game, but simple doesn't mean easy; it can be a challenge, or it can be a brutally hard pain in the thumb if you want it to be. There's an easy mode, but even that doesn't hold your hand. This game is made for people who can put up with losing, because it will win sometimes. You get several weapons, so there are different ways to play, and you can shoot in more than one direction, which you will be glad for very often. Also, you CAN play with a keyboard, but I REALLY recommend a controller. I need it for my playstyle to work at all, and I assume other people will, too.     Graphics are subjective, but they're not bad in this game. You can even choose which one of two totally different art styles you like more, so only the extremely picky should have a problem there.     There's replay value in the form of different "paths" to take in the game, a few choices with massive consequences, three endings and three difficulty modes. There's also extra content in the Steam version. There's an extra level, "Curly Story" where you play as a different character and some other stuff I can't remember right now. Finally, this game has its share of secrets.     There are parts of the game that might seem unfairly hard, which is always a flaw. There aren't many, but there are a few. There's also the fact that this game is relatively hard in general. If you want something hard, play this on hard mode, but there isn't really a perfect easy mode. The easy mode is still challenging, especially at the end. I can't think of many other flaws, but there are ways it could have been better, too. Cave Story FEELS kind of short, for example. I think that's partly because of unusal pacing. There's a boss you have to fight near the end that feels a bit more like a mid-game boss. Maybe that's just me, but I didn't expect it to end when it did.PROS:-Customizable difficulty-Choice of graphics-Choice of music-Interesting and enjoyable story that I can't find a way to talk about without ruining the experience-Extra content and LOTS of replay value-Fast paced platforming and shooting :D-Sort of an adventure game on the side-All around hard game, which isn't even completely lost in easy mode (pro for some)CONS:-Some difficulty that comes from the wrong reasons-All around hard game, which isn't even completely lost in easy mode (con for some)-Dated graphics, which can be changed, but maybe not saved for everyone     I would recommend Cave Story to anyone unless they completely hated either platformers or challenges. If you don't hate them, then I'd say this is a great choice.

												Very fun adventure / platformer in the same vein as Metroid. content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Cave Story is a game created by one man that goes by "Pixel." Words can't even begin to describe his work.It's amazing to think that one man created such an in depth game. This game has to be one of the single greatest games I've played. The game has a strange and mysterious story, one that will make you think. Not only is there so many different achievements, but there are three different endings! Some of these achievements require you to do a certain ending or even just replay the game. Which gives it a good replay value. There's also challenges to race against other players for the best time. If you are a completionist, or a just looking for a good 2D shooter, then this game is for you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												Cave Story is addicting; that is the only way to describe it. The story is extremely good, and it has several decisions and sidequests that would ultimately determine the kinds of tools and weapons you use. The enemies are always fun to battle, the level designs are well thought out, and the level-up mechanics are like nothing I've ever seen before. The side characters: memorable. The bosses: incredible. The dialouge: great. I only wish that there were more games like this. The game was so good, I was only disappointed that it had to end. I'll definitely be replaying it some time soon, so I definitely recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 11, 2013
												Prepare yourself for a game that harkens back to metroid, castlevania, and megaman.  This game was incredible. I got it as part of an indie bundle a while back and played it on my laptop whenever I was away from the house and felt like gaming.  Not only is the presentation great, gameplay solid, balanced, progressive, and fun, but it's a challenge. Most of the bosses you'll figure out the first or second time, but later on the difficulty ramps up and really tests your skills.  There are also bonus levels unlocked by preforming specific tasks or playing on Hell difficulty.  I adore this game and cannot give it enough praise.  I wish more games were like this one.  Somebody somewhere, or a few people, did their job very very well and it shows. This is a shining example of proper and well implemented game design. You will enjoy this game, without a doubt, so go buy it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2, 2013
												I have to say, going into this game, I didn't know what to think. I thought it would be another run of the mill indie platformer. I was wrong, when I realized what it was, I was amazed to find some of the things hidden below the skin of this game. It is mean yeah, as in if you make one wrong move in the story and save, you have to replay the entire game to try to get the best ending..but I like that. It gives a true challenge and sets a goal for the player to follow.  It makes you have feelings for some of the characters you meet in the game, and makes you want to help them.The music:The music is amazing. I could listen to it all day, and I have before, its a well made soundtrack that just always has a better song waiting right behind the one before.The controls:The platforming is a little difficult, because you gain momentum, and when you jump and land on a one block platform, you could easily slide off and fall to your death in a pit of bloody spikes. But other than that, you have pretty tight controls that makes it feel like a challenge to dodge whatever is thrown at you.The bosses: The bosses in this game all have this certain quirk to them that just has to make you smile. The earlier bosses have a pattern that is easy to follow, but after that, the real challenge sets in, and its all skill to beat bosses. I love them, and personally I think they are what makes a huge part of this game fun.Cave story+ is a must buy. It starts slow, but makes it all worth it in the end.Spoliers ahead:Some extra stuff I found:If you find curly's panties in her room it unlocks her story, making her a playable character, and adding another story!If you go for the best ending you will reach hell, which is the hardest part in the game. Its nearly impossible unless you train endlessly, because its a 40 minute segment with 1 life and a "Friend" at the end..

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												An amazing experience, Cave Story plays its cards perfectly. The story is told in a minimalistic fashion but manages to convey a darker and rather deep plot with relatively little text and quite a bit of visual storytelling. Gameplay is also simple and is definitely based off of metroid. The weapon leveling concept is an interesting little way of making players want to avoid tanking hits and seeing each weapon's various levels was something that I looked forward to each time. The music is simple, catchy, and just fits perfectly. Being a platformer, control is important and cave story excels in this providing simple controls with satisfying precision. The look of the game is charming and the simple sprite-based style works extremely well for a simple game with simple charm

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												It's quite an adventure if you have the determination to beat a few of the later bosses.  The game can be pretty fast paced at times but that's what makes it fun.  While I was playing this one of my friends described it as somewhat "Bullet hell" and at certain moments it feels like it.  While you move through the levels you are always trying to upgrade your weapons to level 3 by collecting those golden triangles.  My own adventure was cut short when I left the island on the dragon.  Cave Story is a seemingly simple game but a casual player will want to restart once they learn that simple decisions like taking a gun or talking to certain people at certain times will change their ending.  This will sound crazy but I haven't even finished my second playthrough and I'm already planning on restarting so I can save a character and get the best ending.  I really love this game, it fosters a sense of adventure in such a simple way.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2011
												It's Cave Story with updated graphics and sound. It has translation errors, but that doesn't detract much from the story that you probably already know. To the uninitiated, cave story is a sidescrolling, high difficulty shooter with a whimsical style that makes it hard to get mad at the game for filling you up with bullets. It has a bit of replay value with three endings that, for the most part, are determined through the second half of the game.Dying would be punishing by today's standards, with no lives system and only the ability to reload. It's a small thing to overlook considering how spoiled we are by quick loads.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												Did you like Metroid? Or Castlevania? Cave Story+ is a fantastic Metroidvania-style 2D plattformer, with a wonderful and mysterious story, fun charakters and easy to learn, not very hard to master shooting gameplay. The game itself is short enough, 4 hours, if this isn't the first game you have ever played. But then there's an alternative ending plus a lot of side quests, you may not have done the first time playing Cave Story+. Its' charming 8Bit graphics as well as the 8Bit sounds and music will definitely get you, even if you're only 1% the kind of nostalgic videogamer type. I sure am and I strongly recommend Cave Story+. The additional challenge levels may be fun, but after the main game, it's just not entertaining enough. Rather replay the game!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												I say I recommend this game, but I say so with a warning.Don't get me wrong, the gameplay is smooth, the weapons are fun to use, the platforming is challenging but not too frustrating, and the story is original, creative and enjoyable. There are many different enemies, all with different attack patterns, and all the bosses are fun to beat.9 times out of 10 I would recommend this game to friends.However, there's one issue - the endings.I'm the type of person that doesn't really want to look things up while I play a game. I want to play the game, try my best to find all the secrets/powerups/etc., and if I miss a few, I'm fine with it.However, if Cave Story, there are certain points in the game where if you do one thing over another, or pick up one item over another, etc. it will change the entire course of the game.I, not using the internet and not knowing this, played the game as it seemed I should play it, and got to the "normal" ending.And frankly, the "normal" ending is depressing and disappointing.Upon looking it up after beating the game, I discovered there were two more satisfying, exciting endings to the game, that I had missed by doing X during the story, and I wasn't about to go play the entire story again.Cave Story's mechanics are good and the regular story is great until you get to the end.If you're fine with looking up walkthroughs and secrets as you play a game, I highly recommend this game.If not, I might think twice about getting Cave Story, as the ending will disappoint you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 17, 2012
												You're a boy who finds himself in a network of caves, armed only with a "pea shooter." Your mission is to save a race called the "Mimigas" from being used as weapons of mass destruction by a deranged and psychotic doctor, whose power runs wild courtesy of a powerful cursed crown. Run, shoot, and jump your way through the 2-D adventure of a lifetime as you explore and experiment with a simple yet deep campaign.For those who already have this game down to a science, there is additional content in the form of new levels and remastered graphics and music, as well as a retranslated script courtesy of NiCOLAS. This is, without a doubt, the greatest, most influential, inspirational, and most fully realized indie game in recent history. If your yourself are an indie developer, or are a fan of good retro video games, you owe it to yourself to experience this game to its fullest.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												I say I recommend this game, but I say so with a warning.Don't get me wrong, the gameplay is smooth, the weapons are fun to use, the platforming is challenging but not too frustrating, and the story is original, creative and enjoyable. There are many different enemies, all with different attack patterns, and all the bosses are fun to beat.9 times out of 10 I would recommend this game to friends.However, there's one issue - the endings.I'm the type of person that doesn't really want to look things up while I play a game. I want to play the game, try my best to find all the secrets/powerups/etc., and if I miss a few, I'm fine with it.However, if Cave Story, there are certain points in the game where if you do one thing over another, or pick up one item over another, etc. it will change the entire course of the game.I, not using the internet and not knowing this, played the game as it seemed I should play it, and got to the "normal" ending.And frankly, the "normal" ending is depressing and disappointing.Upon looking it up after beating the game, I discovered there were two more satisfying, exciting endings to the game, that I had missed by doing X during the story, and I wasn't about to go play the entire story again.Cave Story's mechanics are good and the regular story is great until you get to the end.If you're fine with looking up walkthroughs and secrets as you play a game, I highly recommend this game.If not, I might think twice about getting Cave Story, as the ending will disappoint you.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												The music is phenominal, with three different styles to choose from. Original, remastered, or new, all with their own respective charms. There are also two graphical modes, retro and new, but they still feature the pixel art style. This game introduces a new twist on an old mechanic, levels. In Cave Story, every weapon has three levels, each getting more powerful as you progress. However, the plot has been done before in other formats, and isn't particularly interesting. The entire game is basically a shoot-'em-up, musically intense, unique game that will keep you playing until the very end. 11/10 must play classic.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2013
												Quite possibly one of the best indie games to be ever released on the PC, later on the Nintendo 3DS as well.You play as a young man who wakes up in a mysterious cave without any memory of who he is or why he is there.Soon he meets a group of rabbit-like creatures called Mimigas who are being tormented by a mad doctor.This mad doctor is kidnapping the Mimigas and are using them for horrific experiments and he is planning something big and horrible.It is up to the young man to help the Mimigas fight back and save them, as well as several other characters, from the evil mad doctor while also discovering more and more about the cave itself.A must buy for anyone who just love retro-style games like this.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												I found Cave Story to be one of the better games I've played. With retro graphics and sound, it does feel more like the nostalgic games that inspired the creator to make this game. The action sequences scale at a somewhat good pace and the storyline is easy to follow, even if it raises more questions than answers. However, the Steam release does not have enough features to warrent the $10.00 price tag. Furthermore, the Steam release inhibits the ability to mod the game, although it is still possible. Graphics: 8/10 -Although many of the tile sets and enemy graphics are varied, in a few areas, the bleed together a little bit, making it harder to see.Sound: 9/10 -One of the better soundtracks I've heard, though not perfect.Gameplay: 7/10 -The controls are a little clunky. This extends to a jet-pack item late in the game. The challenge spikes a bit later in the game, too.Storyline: 9/10 -Despite a lack of proper foreshadowing at times (possibly due to being lost in translation), the storyline is flawless otherwise.Replay Value: 6/10 -You could run through the game with varying loadouts by the end, but there is no replay value beyond that. Mods add a variety of challenges, though the majority of them have much higer difficulty than the end of the game.Overall, this game recieves 8/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												Cave Story is a wonderfull game. The story is empowering yet heartrending at times, the difficulty curve is smooth (if you play with no guides), both versions of the graphics are spot on, and I can't stop listening to the music. The game handles like an epic cross between metroid and mega-man. The controlls are customisable and you can even plug in a USB controler. With all the chalenges and achevements there is no reason to get this game, even If you already have another version. I only have one problem: the "new" music is just awfull. Stick with origonal for an 8-bit feel and remastered for 16-bit. Casual or hardcore, if you wan't to see just how good an Indie game can be, play this now. For what I got out of this I would pay at least twice as much.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 13, 2013
												Yes, it's Cave Story. Yes, you can get the original free from the cave story website. Yes, this one costs money.And yes, this game is worth it.Just like the original, you follow the story playing as an unnamed (until later) hero. This game features one of the most iconic stories in any indie games, and it is no doubt that this game is arguably one of the most recognised adventure games ever. Shooting enemies and levelling up your weapons feel rewarding, and the boss battles can be fun yet challenging. Honestly, I really liked the graphics too. It felt so clean and easy to look at, and in my opinion it was a big improvement from the original. Of course, this game allows you to play the game just as if it's the old version - music and the graphics can be changed to suit the experience you want.Unfortunately, like the old game, this game can be a tad bit taxing if you want to get the best results possible - if you don't play it the 'correct' way, it won't allow you to do certain tasks. However, you can always experiment with various branches of story by making new saves. Backtracking is also not ideal for people who want a variety of gameplay, because there are some amounts of them.TL;DR: Get this game. I guarantee you will enjoy it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												There is a lot to recommend about Cave Story, and some issues. I loved the original, thought it was great and picked Cave Story+ up. Having replayed it quite a few sore spots stick out.1. Unskippable scenes before boss fights. There is no excuse for this anymore. There's a lot of dialogue and it doesn't move very fast.2. Not many checkpoints. There are definitely some areas where you'll die and have to replay quite a bit. This is especially bad near the end of the game.3. Grindy sections. Near the end of the game all your weapons are returned to level 1. Additionally the platforming is pretty brutal. Fortunately (or unfortunately) there are unlimited bats. This means all too often you will end up killing bats to replenish your health and recharge your weapons 1 tick at a time (and those bats are sloooow). It's also a section where you end up fighting a mini-boss with no save point. So if you don't beat him you have to do it all over again.It's a classic. No question, and there are a lot of secrets and branching story paths that make it re-playable, along with some super hard sections if your after the "true" ending. This is not a run-and-gun platformer, it's a precision platformer with shooting involved.

												I love the music in this game!  The arrangement from Cave Story + is just so good, I want to play this soundtrack all the time now.  Originally this game came out in 2004 as Doukutsu Monogatari and was a little freeware job created by Daisuke Amaya, also know as Pixel.  He developed, designed and programmed the whole beast by himself and it took five years to boot. The game grew in popularity and has since been ported to everything under the sun, even calculators.  (They apparently do a lot more since my Ti-86 back in college.)  If you're going to play this,  do it with a controller because I could never see beating those last four bosses with just the keyboard....unless you're a Jedi...

content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												Cave Story, the original Cave Story, was an amazing in-browser game, all made by a single man, with multiple endings and weapons, a touch of Metroid, and was an all around good game. While the graphics quality was not what it is in Cave Story + and Cave Story 3D, or something like Megaman X or Call of Duty: Black Ops, it was all amazing and fun. Now with Cave Story +, the graphics have increased in quality, have more modes like Curly Mode and Challenge Mode,  Options settings,  is more portable compared to the in-browser version, now has a difficulty setting, and is all around amazing. An improvement on something already great, that's what this is. I recommend this game for all audiences, but this game can get difficult if you want to get the best ending.

												Ah, Cave Story. Our tale is sad but beautiful. I never honestly got past the part with the dogs but if anyone has a strategy let me know! Anyway, this has got to be the most creative, yet intriguing games I've ever played what with it's embrassive story, it's quaint art and very catchy music. This indie game was all made by one man so props to him. If you want the full review go to youtube.com and type in the search bar: somecallmejohnny Cave Story, it's by some call me johnny titled: Johnny vs. Cave Story, he does great reviews as well by the way. I truly haven't dived balls deep into this yet. If there's anything wrong with it is that it's very difficult to me so it's not a casual gamer's delight, but it's not so ♥♥♥♥ing hard it will haunt you for the rest of your dreams like Ghosts n' Goblins. So with that said all in all I give this game 4/5 stars, I wish that the controls on teh PC weren't as wonky and that steam would put this up for free as it's free on the publisher of this game's official website. If you get this great game, good luck and have fun!P.S. Be very careful about the choices you make in the game, it WILL AFFECT YOUR GAMEPLAY ON A IGNORMOUS LEVEL. Be very smart with what you do.

												Cave Story is a game created by one man that goes by "Pixel." Words can't even begin to describe his work.It's amazing to think that one man created such an in depth game. This game has to be one of the single greatest games I've played. The game has a strange and mysterious story, one that will make you think. Not only is there so many different achievements, but there are three different endings! Some of these achievements require you to do a certain ending or even just replay the game. If you are a completionist, or a just looking for a good 2D shooter, then this game is for you.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												I never really understood the hype for the game, so I gave it a shot. I downloaded the free version of it ages ago but never really had any impetus to finish it, until I traded in a duplicate copy of Super Meat Boy on Steam for CS+. I played it on the original graphics and sound mode and thought it was all right, but not spectacular. I remember hearing how it was supposed to be an amazing or worthwhile metroidvania, but it felt too linear, too talky and I didn't feel the items were utilized to their fullest extent. The final boss gauntlet felt like a needless waste of my time and I didn't really get a feel for the art style or the Japanesque-ness of the game either.I don't feel this game warrants a "no" recommendation, though. I'm not too crazy about it and think it is totally overhyped, but it's not a *bad* game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 9, 2012
												A very nice and fun Metroidvainia. There's no real permanent weapon upgrades. Killing enemies will give you experience with that weapon, which will level it up and make it stronger. But If you get hit, you lose experience. The game encourages skill, but is not cruel if you're having a bad day. Cave Story also has some lite humor. It wont win any comedic awards, but will get a decent chuckle out of ya.While I haven't made it too far, the story is interesting enough to keep your attention, but again, it won't win any awards(from what little I've seen).Definately worth picking up. Keep in mind that there is a free version on the internet, and that the "Plus" version on steam is merely a very nice HD texture pack, plus some bonus content. Also "Plus" has the "Official" translation, while the free version is done by fans. Don't let that fool you though, the Free translation is top notch.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												Oh Cave Story, you make me so mad but I love you so. Retro indie platformers are as numerous and iffy as Zombie Survival Strategies among nerds, but this is not only the one that probably inspired them all, it's still the best of the bunch that I've played. The shooting and platforming is fun and challenging, especially once you get the machine gun, which shoots bullets so hard it rockets your little body into the air, giving you a nice form of psuedo-flying. On top of all that, it has an involving, well written story. That said, t's challenging to the point where it often feels unfair, though not undoable. Unfortunately, the toughest parts are almost always preceeded by a lengthy, unskippable cutscene, a problem that the + edition apparently never fixed. The plus edition only adds some challenge modes as far as I can tell, so I don't think it's worth ten dollars since the freeware is still out there and easily, legally available. But if you see it on sale for a buck or two, buy it

content:
Posted: July 4, 2012
												If you're a fan of the old school 2d classic side scrollers such as Metriod or Castlevania, then is this the game for you. This amazing little indie game starts off a little confusing with the player being thrown into some sort of hostage situation but the moment the game begins to pick up the pace you can tell the game is going to be good. The game can be frustrating at parts, similar to the frustration one might have had with the old 2d side scrollers mentioned before, but the overall gaming experience is quite refined and well worth a play through. My gameplay time was seven hours but each hour was filled with great gaming goodness. The retro 8-bit score of the game must also be mentioned, as it definitely set the mood for many scenes and battles in the game perfectly.8.5/10.0

												I’m pretty burnt out on the whole indie retro fad but I enjoyed this game. Where I think a lot of these retro games go wrong is when they implplement shoddy controls like the NES games of yore. That makes it not fun to play. I’m pleased to say that Cave Story has excellent controls, though, and is a lot of fun to play.This reminded me of old NES games such as Metroid but felt like an improvement because it controls so well. The final boss fight was a challenge to beat, but not because it was cheap or frustrating. It was merely difficult and required some skill to get through.I wish more retro games would stick to Cave Story’s formula and go with fun over frustration as a game mechanic.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												Cave Story is a wonderful little game. The graphics and audio are charming, and compliment each other well. The characters and dialogue are pleasant and fun. The platforming  is very good, but not quite perfect. Variety of fun weapons that "level up" individually when you pick up XP from enemies, which is a very fun mechanic. However, when you take damage, your current weapon loses XP... in later areas this happens quickly, and can cripple your player by instantly downgrading your level 3 weapon to a level 1, rendering it mostly ineffective. Some metroid style elements that require you to get an ability, and go back to previous areas to get to new areas. Boss encounters are repetitive, and save spots can be poorly placed, requiring you to go through long areas again, or watch long cutscenes repeatedly if you die. Overall a great game, very fun, highly recommended. Looking forward to a sequel.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Cave Story, by this time an era, while not the best, remains an ejonyable platforming game, with small Metroidvania motifs. It remains an important game due to the fact that it demonstrated the high quality production values a (back then) freeware game could achieve. It slowly introduced a fair amount of people to the indie game community, which further grew with games like Aquaria, Braid, Darwinia, among others. It was the foundation of the modern indie game.Aso for the game itself, it totally bears some merits on its 16-bit era styled graphics, its great weapon diversity, a solid-if-simple storyline, entertaining characters, relatively big world, and catchy chiptune music. While I can't say it is necesarily a must play in this time and age anymore, it remains an important piece of history on indie games, and an entertaning and solid small game.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												The original indie platformer, designed to prove that you don't need a huge budget to make a real good game. It succeeded. Cavestory is a beautifully simple platformer about an android who wants to save a floating island of rabbit people. He does so w/ the help of fun characters like Balrog, Professor Booster & Curly Brace. It's a cartoonish & colorful adventure w/ a real heart & soul. Tons of hidden content & several different endings.If you're unsure if you want to buy this game or not, the original freeware version is still available for download @ http://www.cavestory.org/  It doesn't have some of the other modes & features that this version does of course, but pretty much everything in the normal game is there.Edit 1/17/16:The game crashes when completing the challenges due to it trying to access non-existent leaderboards. That makes my recommendation a bit shakey.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
												I think that Cave Story is a great game with a wonderful, and deep, story that adds heavily to the amazing gameplay. It’s a fun retro-style platformer game with a stunning soundtrack and loveable characters. I’ve spent a long time playing Cave Story from different points in the game on my Wii, on the free version of Cave Story, and a little on Cave Story+, however I don’t really like Cave Story+ all that much because I prefer the older look and sound of the game. I also don’t like how Quote’s outfit changes color based on the different difficult settings, however I do like that there are different difficulty settings. If you download the free version of Cave Story there are many different tools that you can download to mess around with Cave Story. You can also edit all the sprites which is something I enjoyed doing with the free version of Cave Story. You can also find the music for the game on the Cave Story website, along with some game art, and game saves to download. If you aren’t sure if you want to buy Cave Story+ or not, I would download the free version first and see if you like it. If you do, why not buy Cave Story+ to support the developer? $15 may seem like a lot but if you really want to support the developer then go ahead! I fell in love with this game and I’m sure you will too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 5, 2016
												Cave Story was one of the first mega-hit indie games.  First released as freeware in 2004 (still available here!) it took the world by storm with its deep story, nostalgic graphics, and beautiful chiptune music.  Remastered for modern systems by NiCaLiS, the Plus version adds HD graphics, remastered music, and new secrets to find.  Also Steam Achievements.You wake up not knowing your past, alone in a dark cave.  The events that follow as you explore the vast cave system will change the world.  I’m not going to tell you much about the story, as it really is one of the strong points of this Metroidvania-style adventure game.There are about a dozen weapons to collect and upgrade, numerous secret items to collect, and three different endings to see, depending on your choices throughout the story.  All told the game only lasts a few hours on easy mode but it gets much more difficult on Normal and Hard modes.The music stands out among chiptune soundtracks as one of the best ever made.  Upbeat and peppy, it will bring a smile to your face every time you hear it.  This game would feel right at home among the classics on NES, both in style and substance.  The graphics are gorgeous.  The art might be simple, but its so enjoyable, warm, and inviting.  You instantly get attached to the cute Mimiga who inhabit the cave, even without knowing anything about them.  Just based on the cuteness of their sprites, you know they’re THE BEST.Enemies are numerous and varied, the caves are vast and full of side tunnels and secrets to find.  You can’t collect and see everything on one playthrough (that would take at least three) but the main story beats are always there.  This is a game that begs to be dived into and savored.Cave Story is the brainchild of one man, Daisuke “Pixel” Amaya, who developed it from scratch in his spare time.  It remains one of the pinnacles of independent gaming, even today.  A quirky, engaging tale told through some of the best gameplay and art the world has ever seen.  Everyone should play this game.Cave Story is available on (deep breath) Steam, Humble, Linux, Mac, Amiga, PSP, Xbox, GBA, Nintendo DS, and Nintendo 3DS (port by NIS America).

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												Cave Story is a wonderfull game. The story is empowering yet heartrending at times, the difficulty curve is smooth (if you play with no guides), both versions of the graphics are spot on, and I can't stop listening to the music. The game handles like an epic cross between metroid and mega-man. The controlls are customisable and you can even plug in a USB controler. With all the chalenges and achevements there is no reason to get this game, even If you already have another version. I only have one problem: the "new" music is just awfull. Stick with origonal for an 8-bit feel and remastered for 16-bit. Casual or hardcore, if you wan't to see just how good an Indie game can be, play this now. For what I got out of this I would pay at least twice as much.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2013
												A fun story about killer robots, killer rabbits and a killer scientist who wants to take over the world. Features great music, pleasant aesthetics and great platformer action, with a dose of RPG. Has THREE different endings - bad, normal and good. Really, it's a masterpiece, and it's all the work of one guy!I have only ONE complaint: the good ending. Not the ending in itself, but achieving it. To even ENABLE this ending, you have to perform one action everyone, including myself, thought it unintuitive and unfair. It also requires quite a sequence of actions afterwards, with one other being almost equally unintuitive, in the middle of a hazardous area.But, really, other than that, this game is great in every aspect. Recommend.

												Honestly, for what hasn't been said already, this game is great. I am a fan of games that can make a 2D combat system fun and interesting but not overly complex.-Like a bullethell, you rely on dodging objects with position and timing.-Weapon levels go up and down based on how well you're doing (being hit or not).-Later upgrades further how you move.The story itself is grand. While it could have done with a bit more on the actual exploration side, you can completely sidestep it unless you want to finish it in the many alternate ways. It's a fun game to complete once or twice, and I would give it a try if you haven't.

												I've heard so much about this game before but never at all gave it a try. In fact I bought it about 4 years ago and never installed it until just last week. This game is so much fun and so frustrating that even after you die to a boss the first, second, third time you just want to keep going. And the music.....omg the music is so amazing. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												First things first. This game falls under a catagory known as 'Nintendo Hard'. As in, it harkens back to the days where men were tasty snacks, monsters were overpowered, and the princess was guarded by a REAL dragon. This game has three endings, from Worst to Best. I won't spoil anything, of course... But the ending you recieve depends on your gameplay... And who you manage to save.Plotwise, Cave Story is rather dark, surrounded by fluffy humor. The floating island you are in (You'll find out why you are there later, if you do well.), is the natural home for a race of innocent bunnies, that survive on flowers. Mimiga. How can that be the set-up for a dark, sometimes depressing story? You'll just have to find out.If you enjoy a challenging platformer, and you love a story that grows more immersive as you go along... Cave Story is for you. All ye wimps, go play something a tad easier and lighter.

Posted: July 4, 2012
												If you're a fan of the old school 2d classic side scrollers such as Metriod or Castlevania, then is this the game for you. This amazing little indie game starts off a little confusing with the player being thrown into some sort of hostage situation but the moment the game begins to pick up the pace you can tell the game is going to be good. The game can be frustrating at parts, similar to the frustration one might have had with the old 2d side scrollers mentioned before, but the overall gaming experience is quite refined and well worth a play through. My gameplay time was seven hours but each hour was filled with great gaming goodness. The retro 8-bit score of the game must also be mentioned, as it definitely set the mood for many scenes and battles in the game perfectly.8.5/10.0

												This is truely a great game. It revitalizes the spirit of old school games like Castlevania and Metroid and at the same time is fresh enough to "compete" along side the big name games. I put quotes (heh) around compete because gaming shouldn't be about  which game has the best graphics or is using the lastest, greatest technology... it should be about creating experiences that will always be remembered. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2013
												I played the free version of this game, which you can just find at cavestory.org, but then I ended up getting it again from Humble Indie Bundle 7 and started playing it. It's essentially the same game but with a slightly updated soundtrack and graphics, and I believe you can play as Curly if you obtain a certain item. Still something worth playing as it's a fun (and VERY challenging) short game. Think of it as a shooter/platformer kind of thing. The story itself is pretty neat, and the secrets you can find are as well. If you don't want to buy it, then I'd suggest at least playing the free version since it's exactly the same thing minus Curly mode and the graphical/soundtrack upgrades (which the original soundtrack is good anyway and the graphics aren't even THAT updated) and it won't take much of your time, yet you'll most likely enjoy the experience and probably cry at how hard the later levels/bosses are. It has multiple endings too depending on certain choices you make, with the "true" ending being the hardest to get (I haven't even gotten it yet, that last boss is ugh).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
												9/10 First time I ever loved a platformer.Cave Story is the brilliant child of Studio Pixel, a one-man company. Pixel spent five years developing Cave Story in his free time. There's a lot of TLC put into the design, and it really does show. Now I sucked at platforming going into this game. I just did not have the skillset. This game gave me the necessary skills to succeed in a platformer, and really ramped it up as I neared the True Ending. The music was awesome, and in Cave Story+, You get three choices of soundtrack:Original: From the freeware version of the PC gameNew: From the EU patch of the Nintendo WiiWare port of the gameRemastered: From the fully-3D Nintendo 3DS remake of the game.The graphics can also be in their lesser Original quality, or their newly refined Remastered quality. This game has a lot of wonderful elements, and you'll likely log HOURS of gameplay in this game. The Soundtrack, in whichever form, is catchy, and you'll definitely jam out to it. With all said, I give this game a 9/10, docking points nly for the sudden intensity spike for activating the true ending's route, granted it was to be expected

content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												What is there to say? Cave Story (or in this case, Cave Story+) is a fun and challenging game with a lot of indie developer heart put into it. You can tell why this game took four years to make, because everything is filled with polish. The enemies are varried in size, shape, behavior, and personality, and the backstory is never shoved in your face, instead slowly being revealed to your amnesia suffering protaginist. The only issues I have are that the platforming is pretty floaty, which can be annoying, and the fact that there is pretty much ZERO chance of anyone figuring out how to get the best ending without an internet guide.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 4, 2015
												I really love this game. I didn't play it until it was on steam, but the characters are really charming and I like that I'm just a 3rd party person in the story and not a silly little emo anime guy. I like the plot. I like the characters. I like the aesthetic, the music, it's all good! The 'starter controls' are a bit unituitive at first, but rebinding them made things work fine. Using a keyboard was kind of a hassle, but I couldn't get my controller to work.Anyway the game is like a platformer RPG...uhm..adventure...game? It works kinda like a standard platformer, but you have a gun to shoot things and after shooting things you get stuff that makes your gun more powerful. I mean the combat isn't amazing or anything, but it works for what it is. The story is really nice though that's probably the thing I would praise the most. I like that it has branching paths too and that things can be different depending on how you play. I couldn't help myself and had to get the best ending so yeah.Def recom.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												The game is nice and all, but I have no idea where all these ratings and popularity come from.The amount of text is relatively small, so while the story is there, there isn't enough content to warrant calling it touching.The graphics could be called great if the game was released 30 years ago. Nowadays it's just another well done imitation of ancient 8-bit graphics.The gameplay is good I guess, though I'm not the biggest fan of 2D shooters. However, the amount of backtracking the game expects is CRAZY. The player is expected to go back and forth multiple times, and if he misses discussing something with some character, there's even more backtracking.Having multiple endings is nice, but no way in hell most players could understand what is necessary for the perfect ending without reading online manuals. Talking to a character makes a random item disappear from the map later in game, with zero explanations — really?With ratings of the game being so high, I expected much more than an average game.

												Absolutely classic platform/ shooter type game. Gameplay flows really well. Story's a tad odd at first, but soon comes together. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												Cave Story is a very classic game, mixing platforms, action and adventure, with several levels of difficulty (Easy / Normal / Hard).We control Quote, a boy without particular capacity, except for jumping. During the game, the player is going to collect objects and especially weapons, with which he's going to equip himself. Weapons have generally 3 power levels, their power increasing thanks to jewels collected by killing monsters. Several weapons will be usable during the adventure, whether it is the pistol, the rocket launcher or the sword, all having a different power and range.Quote finds himself in a flying island, divided into several sectors, accessible thanks to teleport, as the village Mimiga, the center of this universe, the sand zone or the plantation. Quote has a memory loss and nobody knows what he is doing here. Nevertheless, he's going to begin helping Mimigas, a sort of rabbits forming the local population, fighting the Doctor, the villain of Cave Story+ which wants to destroy everything. The game is punctuated by the appearance of boss and recurring characters, such as Balrog and Misery, the funny minions of the Doctor. Several purposes are possible, depending on acts and choices of the player, what will ask to redo at least twice the game to have an overview of all the possible purposes.Graphically it is very simple, but it is also beautiful and harmonious. Musics are good and addictive. Bestiary is rather wide and varied. So, every world has its own identity, and it is pleasant to cross them. Finally, the length is more than correct for the one who takes time to make all the secondary quests (about 10 hours). Furthermore, additional contents are unlocked thanks to side quests during the session, such as a game version with Curly, the feminine character of Cave Story, or challenges such as Boss Attack or Time Attack.Conclusion: a good game, classic, with a good level of difficulty.

												Honestly, for what hasn't been said already, this game is great. I am a fan of games that can make a 2D combat system fun and interesting but not overly complex.-Like a bullethell, you rely on dodging objects with position and timing.-Weapon levels go up and down based on how well you're doing (being hit or not).-Later upgrades further how you move.The story itself is grand. Exploring the grim remains of the island is a wonderful effort. While it could have done with a bit more on the actual exploration side, you can completely sidestep it unless you want to finish it in the many alternate ways. It's a fun game to complete once or twice, and I would give it a try if you haven't.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												This game is a masterpiece in my opinion. As you know, pixelated indie games are really hard to come by these days {Obvious sarcasm is obvious} It's a 2D Platformer that draws inspiration from older Megaman games along with Metroid. PROS~-Has awesome story that actually drives you to continue, unlike some games where it's just obligatory-3 different endings-TONS and TONS of secrets to make replaying a joy-Interesting, challenging, and unique boss fights-Environments with depth and a suprising amount of exploration for 2D Platformers-Lots of weapons to collect-Depending on your skill and difficulty, this game can last 5 hours in story-Difficult but fair-Incredible soundtrack (Best I've ever heard)CONS~-Platforming can be frustrating due to floaty jumps-Some bosses have unfair difficulty-Hard mode is, well hard (Beyond belief)-Some secrets require you to look them up, which beginner players wouldn't know to do-Difficulty spike at the end of the game-Save points that become scarcer and scarcer, requiring you to stay alive or be punishedAll around this game's pros heavily outweigh the cons. I highly suggest this game to anyone who appreciates video games in general. If you just like video games like Call of Duty, and don't have an open mind, I would say stay away from this game (Or anything on steam really). But to everyone else, this will be money very well spent.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												I played this game when it ws free and I bought it here to support it. This is a great example of what a game "Remaster" should look like. The entire game and soundtrack has been revamped which I personally enjoyed but there are people who like the original Pixel look and can choose to make the game look that way again. Same for the soundtrack. This doesn't make or break a game but they are nice touches.The story is nice and engaging as you try to figure out where your place is in the history of this floating island. Also there are multiple endings depending on some choices you make, how brave you are and how observant. So good luck with that. The controls (Not gameplay) remind me of Super Meat Boy in terms of the precision you need for some platforming, but the game is mostly a sidescroling shooter. The weapon system is level based that you have to maintain with kills while damage not only hurts you but delevels your weapons as well. This isn't as rough as it sounds as each weapon has 3 levels the changes how it shoots so regaining those levels never feels like a chore. This version also adds a couple new modes of gameplay so veteran players can enjoy some new content. It's not more story mind you, but there is a time attack mode where you rush to beat levels within a time limit which brings its own achievements to unlock if your into that. Also, there is a Boss Rush mode where you navigate a hub world and fight each boss of the game in order and consecutively. Both were very enjoyable though it does have a big learning curve if you hope to achieve the top rankings in these modes. Also there is a NewGame+ mode where you can play through as another main character which was a nice touch. She isn't a silent protagonist either so it does change the game slightly, but not much. It's nice for a second playthough.I really enjoyed this game, hopefully I did it justice in this review. This game is not easy even when you tone down the difficulty but it's very rewarding as you move through the story. This game has a big personality and it shines through its chracters and how you feel as you see them come and go. Pick it up.TL;DRIt's good bruh, you gonna like it bruh. Story and modes, story and modes!

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												It hearkens back to an older era of gaming, specifically the SNES era, when games started developing storylines proper, and creating characters you could truly identify with. The music is pleasant and fitting, particularly "Moonsong", and the storyline is engaging and leaves you wanting more as you progress through the game. The fact that a single individual made this game, in his spare time, over the course of five years, is truly marvelous. Granted this is an "updated" version, but it's still as enjoyable as ever! Go destroy The Doctor's plans, and save the Mimigas!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
The GoodFantastic story (multiple endings with challenging bosses and secrets to find!)Amazing soundtrack (three versions available; the original chiptune, remastered along with a new take on the themes)Aesthetically pleasing art style (includes the original art style as well as a new (less pixley) rendition)Gameplay is great. A good variety of weapons and items each doing something unique, enemies and bosses are very diverse and the world throws something new and challenging at each turnNew Time-trials/challenges (which were not available in free version)The BadNothing of noteOpinionFor those who played the original free version of Cave Story, Cave Story+ adds a variety of new features without sacrificing what made the original so great. First of all there are options to how the game looks and feels. There are three versions of the soundtrack (original, new and remastered) each standing on their own merits against the orginal as well as a redone art style (less pixley), though the option to play the game as the original was presented is there. Additionally there are achievements and time trials/competitive challenges that are included with the game as bonus content. Well worth it for the story alone!

content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												"Enchanting!"That's the one word I can use to describe this beautiful game.Though I'm not someone that has always been overly fascinated with indie games, but if I had to choose my favourite indie game ever made, this game right here would without a doubt be on my Top List somewhere!The music is delightful and will get stuck in your head for hours.I feel tender towards the characters, and sometimes even the villains too.The enemies, obstacles are weapons are perfectly constructed to fit in with the gameplay.And with such an awesome secret ending to unlock that actually adds more challenge to the game that you already know, I can do nothing but applaud the person who made this.I can see that a lot of heart went into developing this game.And in some ways I find this game to also be very inspirational in terms of creativity!You may not love this game as much as I do, but at least give this game a try.At least once. I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
The GoodFantastic story (multiple endings with challenging bosses and secrets to find!)Amazing soundtrack (three versions available; the original chiptune, remastered along with a new take on the themes)Aesthetically pleasing art style (includes the original art style as well as a new (less pixley) rendition)Gameplay is great. A good variety of weapons and items each doing something unique, enemies and bosses are very diverse and the world throws something new and challenging at each turnNew Time-trials/challenges (which were not available in free version)The BadNothing of noteOpinionFor those who played the original free version of Cave Story, Cave Story+ adds a variety of new features without sacrificing what made the original so great. First of all there are options to how the game looks and feels. There are three versions of the soundtrack (original, new and remastered) each standing on their own merits against the orginal as well as a redone art style (less pixley), though the option to play the game as the original was presented is there. Additionally there are achievements and time trials/competitive challenges that are included with the game as bonus content. Well worth it for the story alone!
